---
title: "Compare SARS-CoV2 case count and virome seq abundance in El Paso, TX , May 2022 - February 2023"
output: html_notebook
---

load packages
```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(data.table)
library(stringr)
library(dplyr)
library(readxl)
library(lubridate)
library(tidyquant)
library(tidyr)
library(ggpubr)
library(rstatix)
library(rprojroot)

```

set paths and filenames
```{r}
### files
pathogen_table=sprintf(
  "%s/data/wastewater_specific_pathogen_abundance_table1.tsv", 
  find_rstudio_root_file())
metadata_table=sprintf(
  "%s/data/wastewater_sample_metadata_table1.tsv", 
  find_rstudio_root_file())
el_paso_case_table=sprintf(
  "%s/data/el_paso_weekly_sarscov2_cases_summary1.tsv", 
  find_rstudio_root_file())

```

load pathogen table, metadata table, format by week
```{r}
meta_dt <- fread(metadata_table, sep = "\t", header = T )


SARS_virome_seq_dt <- fread(pathogen_table, sep = "\t", header = T) %>%
  filter(Virus_name == "SARS coronavirus 2") %>%
  mutate(RPKMF = case_when(Detection == "below_detectable_level" ~ 0,
                           TRUE ~ RPKMF ))
  
SARS_EPTX_week_dt  <- merge(SARS_virome_seq_dt, meta_dt, by = "sample_ID") %>%
  filter(City == "El Paso, TX") %>%
  mutate(Week = floor_date(Date, "weeks", week_start = 1)) %>%
  group_by(Week) %>%
  summarize(RPKMF = mean(RPKMF)) %>%
  filter(Week >= '2022-06-01')
```

load sars-cov2 case table, format by week
```{r}
## already formatted as weekly summary
EPTX_week_cases_dt <- fread(el_paso_case_table, sep = "\t", header = T)


EPTX_week_cases_dt$Week <- as.Date(EPTX_week_cases_dt$Week)


```

plot SARS-Cov2 data as point plot and moving average
```{r}
ggplot() + 
  geom_point(data = SARS_EPTX_week_dt, 
            aes(x=Week, y=600*(RPKMF), color="Virome Seq"), 
            alpha = 0.2, size = 1) +
  geom_point(data = EPTX_week_cases_dt, 
            aes(x=Week, y=daily_avg_cases, color="Case Rate"), 
            alpha = 0.2, size = 1) +
  geom_ma(data = SARS_EPTX_week_dt, 
          aes(x=Week, y=600*(RPKMF), color="Virome Seq"), 
          ma_fun = SMA, n = 3, lwd = 1.5) +
  geom_ma(data = EPTX_week_cases_dt, 
          aes(x=Week, y=daily_avg_cases, color="Case Rate"), 
          ma_fun = SMA, n = 3, linetype = "solid", size = 1.5) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = as.Date('2022-10-10'), color = "grey60") +
  geom_text(aes(x= as.Date('2022-10-10'), y = 700, label = "Summer Wave\n"), angle = 90) +
  geom_text(aes(x= as.Date('2022-10-10'), y = 700, label = "\nWinter Wave"), angle = 90) +
  scale_color_manual(name='Data Type',
                     breaks=c('Virome Seq', 'Case Rate'),
                     values=c('Virome Seq'='#4B4E55', 'Case Rate'='#DDC70F')) +
  labs(x = "Date", title = "El Paso, TX SARS-CoV2 Measurements") +
  theme_bw() +
  scale_y_continuous(name = "Avg. Daily Case Rate (PCR test)",
    sec.axis = sec_axis( trans=~./600, name="Wastewater Sequencing \nAbundance (RPKMF)", label=scales::comma)
  ) +
  scale_x_date(date_labels="%Y-%b",date_breaks  ="1 month")+
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust=1)) 

ggsave(sprintf("%s/charts/SARS-CoV2_EPTX_virome_vs_cases1.pdf", find_rstudio_root_file()), width = 5, height = 4)
```

Pearson correlation and scatter of waves
```{r}
SARS_EPTX_week_dt$dtype = "virome_seq"
SARS_EPTX_week_dtb <- rename(SARS_EPTX_week_dt, value = RPKMF)

EPTX_week_cases_dt$dtype = "case_rate"
EPTX_week_cases_dtb <- rename(EPTX_week_cases_dt, value = daily_avg_cases) %>%
  select(c("Week", "value", "dtype"))

merge_sars_dt <- rbind(SARS_EPTX_week_dtb, EPTX_week_cases_dtb) %>%
  mutate(Wave = case_when(Week >= '2022-10-10' ~ "Winter",
                          Week < '2022-10-10' ~ "Summer",
                          TRUE ~ "idk")) %>%
  group_by(Week, Wave) %>%
  summarize(Cases = value[dtype == "case_rate"],
            RPKMF = value[dtype == "virome_seq"])

summer_dt <- merge_sars_dt %>%
  filter(Wave == "Summer")

cor(summer_dt$RPKMF, summer_dt$Cases)

winter_dt <- merge_sars_dt %>%
  filter(Wave == "Winter")

cor(winter_dt$RPKMF, winter_dt$Cases)

merge_sars_dt %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Cases, y = RPKMF, color = Wave)) +
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(se = F, method = "lm") +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("#466D53", "#83CDC0")) +
  labs(y = "Wastewater Sequencing \nAbundance (RPKMF)", 
       x = "Avg. Daily Case Rate (PCR test)") +
  stat_cor(label.x = 3) +
  theme_bw()
  
ggsave(sprintf("%s/charts/SARS-CoV2_EPTX_virome_vs_cases_wave_scatter1.pdf", find_rstudio_root_file()), width = 4, height = 3)

```
